```{=html}
<div class="presentation-text">Francisco Garre-Frutos</div>
<div id="recursive-text">Experimental psychologist.</div>
<script>
const it_text = document.getElementById("recursive-text");
const it_list = ["Experimental Psychologist.", "Cognitive Neuroscientist.", "Ph.D. student."];
console.log(it_text);
let counter = 0, step = 150, current_text, char_pos = 0, adding = true;

const typewriter = () => {
    setTimeout(() => {
        current_text = it_list[counter];
        if (current_text.slice(0, char_pos) == "") {
          it_text.textContent = " ";
        } else {
          it_text.textContent = current_text.slice(0, char_pos);
        }
        if (adding) {
            if (char_pos >= current_text.length) {
                adding = false;
                setTimeout(() => {
                    typewriter();
                }, 1000);
                return;
            } else {
              char_pos++;
            }
        } else {
            if (char_pos == 0) {
                adding = true;
                counter = (counter < 2)? counter+1: 0;
                current_text = it_list[counter];
            } else {
                char_pos--;
            }
        }
        typewriter();
    }, step)
}

typewriter();

</script>
```

:::{#about}
<br>
I am currently a Ph.D. student in Experimental Psychology in the [Cognitive Neuroscience Group](https://cimcyc.ugr.es/investigacion/grupos/hum379) at the University of Granada, collaboratign with the [Cognition, Attention and Learning Laboratory](https://calluam.wordpress.com/quienes-somos/) (CALL) at the Autonomous University of Madrid. My current work focuses on investigating the extent to which reward-related attentional biases are implicit, automatic, and uncontrollable. I am also very interested in psychometrics applied to experimental psychology, multilevel modeling, signal detection theory and reinforcement learning.
